channel.title: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. Conducts Airstrikes Near Besieged Iraqi Town
item.description: American and other forces have launched an offensive to free the town of Amerli, surrounded by Islamic militants for more than two months and desperately short on food and clean water.
item.content:encoded:
American and other forces have launched an offensive to free the town of Amerli, surrounded by Islamic militants for more than two months and desperately short on food and clean water.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: L. Carol Ritchie

item.title: Liberia's Ebola Routine: Wear Your Temperature On Your Lapel
item.description: NPR producer Nicole Beemsterboer reflects on 10 days in Liberia: children losing parents, young men risking their lives to collect bodies, and the smell of chlorinated hand-washing water everywhere.
item.content:encoded:
NPR producer Nicole Beemsterboer reflects on 10 days in Liberia: children losing parents, young men risking their lives to collect bodies, and the smell of chlorinated hand-washing water everywhere.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Marc Silver

item.title: Saavy PR Campaign Has Lured Many To Fight In Syria's Civil War
item.description: More than 500 people may have traveled from the U.K. to Syria to fight in its civil war. Arun Rath talks to Jessica Stern, author of Terror In The Name Of God, about how it's drawing Westerners.
item.content:encoded:
More than 500 people may have traveled from the U.K. to Syria to fight in its civil war. Arun Rath talks to Jessica Stern, author of Terror In The Name Of God, about how it's drawing Westerners.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Sanctions Against Russia Have Failed To Achieve Political Goals
item.description: Arun Rath talks to former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Steven Pifer about NATO and EU options for confronting Russian aggression in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
Arun Rath talks to former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine Steven Pifer about NATO and EU options for confronting Russian aggression in Ukraine.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Despite Quiet, Ukraine's Novoazovsk Still Feels Like A War Zone
item.description: In Ukraine, worried officials in the southeastern part of the country beefed up their defenses on Saturday as rebel forces slowly moved west following the recent capture of a strategic seaside town.
item.content:encoded:
In Ukraine, worried officials in the southeastern part of the country beefed up their defenses on Saturday as rebel forces slowly moved west following the recent capture of a strategic seaside town.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Soraya Sarhaddi Nelson

item.title: South Africa Condemns Apparent Coup In Lesotho
item.description: Early Saturday, soldiers in the tiny kingdom completely surrounded by South Africa took to the streets amid gunfire, forcing the prime minister to flee. The army has denied a takeover.
item.content:encoded:
Early Saturday, soldiers in the tiny kingdom completely surrounded by South Africa took to the streets amid gunfire, forcing the prime minister to flee. The army has denied a takeover.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: U.N. Peacekeepers Rescued After Being Trapped By Syrian Militants
item.description: Dozens of blue-helmeted Filipino soldiers were extracted after a firefight with militants on the Syrian side of the Golan Heights.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of blue-helmeted Filipino soldiers were extracted after a firefight with militants on the Syrian side of the Golan Heights.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Nicaraguan Miners Trapped After Collapse
item.description: Four miners remain trapped after 22 others were rescued at a gold and silver mine near the south central city of Bonanza.
item.content:encoded:
Four miners remain trapped after 22 others were rescued at a gold and silver mine near the south central city of Bonanza.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: John Walker Jr., Cold War Spy For Soviets, Dies At 77
item.description: The U.S. Navy warrant officer recruited his son, his brother and a friend to help him steal and sell classified message keys to the USSR over a 17-year period.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Navy warrant officer recruited his son, his brother and a friend to help him steal and sell classified message keys to the USSR over a 17-year period.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Poroshenko Says Ukraine Near To 'Full-Scale War'
item.description: Speaking at a meeting of European Union foreign ministers, the Ukrainian president says Kiev is "close to the point of no return," over Moscow's direct support of separatists.
item.content:encoded:
Speaking at a meeting of European Union foreign ministers, the Ukrainian president says Kiev is "close to the point of no return," over Moscow's direct support of separatists.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Why The British Allowed The Rotherham Abuse To Fester
item.description: The Guardian's Randeep Ramesh tells NPR's Scott Simon about the social and societal forces at work in British culture which might have contributed to the cover-up of the Rotherham child abuse case.
item.content:encoded:
The Guardian's Randeep Ramesh tells NPR's Scott Simon about the social and societal forces at work in British culture which might have contributed to the cover-up of the Rotherham child abuse case.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Horses And Toilets In The Kitchen: Terrible Real Estate Photos
item.description: Andy Donaldson was browsing new flats in London when he noticed that some photos in real estate ads are really, really bad. His blog and book showcase some of the worst, as he tells NPR's Scott Simon.
item.content:encoded:
Andy Donaldson was browsing new flats in London when he noticed that some photos in real estate ads are really, really bad. His blog and book showcase some of the worst, as he tells NPR's Scott Simon.

» E-Mail This

item.title: London Evacuees Bore A Painful Cost Of War
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Pam Hobbs about the 75th anniversary of Operation Pied Piper. She was one of the children who were evacuated from London during World War II.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon talks with Pam Hobbs about the 75th anniversary of Operation Pied Piper. She was one of the children who were evacuated from London during World War II.

» E-Mail This

item.title: NIH Hopes Ebola Vaccine Will Help Protect Aid Workers
item.description: Next week, the NIH begins its first clinical trial of a vaccine to prevent Ebola. NPR's Scott Simon talks to Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.
item.content:encoded:
Next week, the NIH begins its first clinical trial of a vaccine to prevent Ebola. NPR's Scott Simon talks to Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.

» E-Mail This

item.title: Fiancée Of Imprisoned Journalist Advocates For His Release
item.description: Mohammed Fahmy is among three Al Jazeera journalists who have been jailed in Egypt on terrorism charges. His fiancée continues to plan their wedding, even as the case languishes.
item.content:encoded:
Mohammed Fahmy is among three Al Jazeera journalists who have been jailed in Egypt on terrorism charges. His fiancée continues to plan their wedding, even as the case languishes.

» E-Mail This
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
